Bone    Signs or symptoms of LCH that affects the bone may include:            - Swelling or a lump over a bone, such as the skull, ribs, spine, thigh bone, upper arm bone, elbow, eye socket, or bones around the ear.     - Pain where there is swelling or a lump over a bone.           Children with LCH lesions in bones around the ears or eyes have a high risk for diabetes insipidus and other central nervous system disease.       Lymph nodes and thymus    Signs or symptoms
